results.title: Thunder Mountain cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Fox Film Corporation and David Howard
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: Red-blooded adventure and colourful romance in this zane grey thrilling story of the west. George O’Brien in Thunder Mountain with Barbara Fritchie Frances Grant for general admission

results.title: The Fang
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The Fang is an animation that uses the animated contributions of past AIM students. Produced and directed by Al MacInnes with the song performed by his band Dan and Al, the Fang celebrates and displays the vast animation techniques and styles used by Al’s peers. The Fang himself is a character around town who wonders what the fang is and discovers that he is the fang, a very much sort after man.

results.title: Darn tootin'
results.brief_description: A 2D hand-drawn animation, ‘Darn tootin’ is a spoof on the masculiny of cowboys depicted in Westerns. The animation has many mixed references…An American accented cowboy rides into town and says hello to a cross-dressing Aussie accented blacksmith. Another American cowboy asks him for a drink, the two walk hand in hand into the saloon (USA pub) bearing a sign reading No Singlets, No thongs (an Australian reference). The foley used throughout places the ‘Western’ town in Australia with the sounds of Australian birds.

results.title: All ears
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Parker, Sunny McGill, Jeane McGill, Bruce McGill, Robyn Blake, David Atkinson and Ben McGill
results.brief_description: A short claymation about an old man whose quiet ‘memory filled’ days are rudely interrupted by a pushy salesman. As the old man contently potters around his flat faintly hearing the outside world he is bombarded by the overbearing hard-sell tactics of a salesman selling hearing aids.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeremy Parker, Sunny McGill, Jeane McGill, Bruce McGill, Robyn Blake, David Atkinson and Ben McGill

results.title: The Great Defender cinema slide
results.creator_credit: British Instructional Films, Associated British Picture Corporation and Thomas Bentley
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: British International Pictures present Matheson Lang Margaret Bannerman. Richard Bird The Great Defender Smashing Sensation - Seething Drama of Unrequited Love.. And the Law Courts! Released by British Empire Films Ltd Not suitable for general exhibition. Coming It looks as if handwritten text has worn away as there are very faint black marks remaining.

results.title: The Harder they come [DVD]
results.brief_description: The first independent feature film produced in Jamaica gave many Americans their first taste of reggae music with musician Jimmy Cliff in the title role, backed by a fabulous reggae soundtrack. Cliff plays Ivan, a naive rural singer who moves to the city in search of fame but is soon impoverished and exploited by the music industry before becoming embroiled in the trade of marijuana and murder; simultaneously Ivan’s music is released to great acclaim and he becomes somewhat of a local anti-hero. As well as offering a unique view of the reggae scene the milieu of this film also offers a de-romanticised view of seedy Kingston life. Indeed Henzell’s style borders on documentary, as he evokes the squalor of the street, the impoverishment of the people and the multi-faceted systemic corruption. Soundtrack includes the title track as well as other reggae hits “You Can Really Get It if You Want It”, “Sitting in Limbo” and “Johnny Too Bad”. Cast includes Basil Keane, Ras Daniel Hartman, Winston Stona, Janet Barkley, Bobby Charlton and Carl Bradshaw.

Indeed Henzell’s style borders on documentary, as he evokes the squalor of the street, the impoverishment of the people and the multi-faceted systemic corruption. Indeed Henzell’s style borders on documentary, as he evokes the squalor of the street, the impoverishment of the people and the multi-faceted systemic corruption. results.title: The Happy toilers
results.creator_credit: Keith David Smith and Children's Library and Craft Movement
results.brief_description: An amateur record of the efforts by children attending a crafts centre in a migrant hostel to build their own swimming pool. Made at Bradfield Park Housing Settlement and the Lane Cove National Park.

results.title: Atlantic Adventure cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures and Albert S. Rogell
results.credit_line: ACMI has used best endeavours to remain in contact with the owners of these objects since their deposit with ACMI in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful and ACMI would welcome any information to assist identify a current contact for their ownership.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: Nancy Carroll Lloyd Nolan Harry Langdon in Atlantic Adventure Not suitable for General Exhibition. A Columbia production There is worn away black handwriting on the plain glass slide which says: Next Wed, Thurs, Fri
